mobs.keywords: abbot man old-man balding bald Samuel
mobs.long_desc: An old man walks past, keeping an eye on his monks.
mobs.desc: A balding old man with a slight hunch in his back wanders about, keeping an eye on his monks.  His rich robes and small spectacles makes him seem wise and learned.  The Abbot is fairly tall and handsome to be cooped up in an abbey all the time.

mobs.long_desc: A thoughtful monk proceeds about his business here.
mobs.desc: A monk dressed in simple robes made of brown fabric wanders about the abbey he loves.  He is obviously well educacted, as would be expected of a monk.

mobs.long_desc: The Sexton is here, tending to the grounds of the abbey.
mobs.desc: A graveyard is not out of place in an abbey, nor are other gardens.  This tired looking, middle aged man is the tender of those places.

mobs.long_desc: A displeased-looking old man walks around grumbling.
mobs.desc: Of all the spiritual people in a position of power, this one seems least relaxed.  Berack seems absolute about acquiring some objective to make his life complete, and would probably stop at nothing to achieve his means.  He is gruff and not as cleanly shaven as one might expect a prior to be.

mobs.long_desc: A gracious Almoner offers you some bread.
mobs.desc: A sweet looking old man stands his place in the almonry.  It seems the Almoner would be willing to give all he can to fix the ails of the world.

mobs.long_desc: A monk is here, reading aloud from a book.
mobs.desc: This monk has the responsibility of reading to the others the ideals and aims of the order to his Brothers.  His low baritone echoes in this vast refectory.

mobs.long_desc: A monk is lying down on a bed here.
mobs.desc: The monk looks pale and tired.  He seems to be suffering from some sort of illness.

mobs.long_desc: A monk is here, busy working on his assigned task.
mobs.desc: The monk seems to be quite good at his task as he seems to be able to work quite fast.  He is the epitome of efficiency.

mobs.long_desc: A monk is here, working in the garden.
mobs.desc: This human male generally tends the herb garden. He's fairly old, but patient, moving slowly and methodically about his work.

mobs.long_desc: A nobleman walks by you.
mobs.desc: The man is obviously of noble birth, as he pays absolutely no attention to those of low birth such as yourself.  You can almost smell the aura of superiority around him.

mobs.long_desc: A muscular monk stands vigilantly here.
mobs.desc: This monk seems different from the rest, as he is using a rather nasty looking maul.  This fellow had spent most of his life learning the martial arts, and he looks quite competent at using it.

mobs.long_desc: A sturdy-looking little mule is standing here.
mobs.desc: This large pack animal is well bred for hauling loads or stout riders.  It is almost certain that this one has been used for many years doing both.  The short light brown hair on it is fine and gives the beast an attractive look.

mobs.long_desc: A scruffy, ill-tempered cook stands here mixing foods.
mobs.desc: This man simple does not look like he enjoys life.  The cook seems worn out and constantly tired, disliking his occupation yet he continues to make food for the monks.

mobs.long_desc: A flour covered baker mills about here.
mobs.desc: This baker is kind of old.  He is dusted nearly head to toe with flour and specks of dough spot his uniform.  There is something a bit wrong with his left leg, as he limps on occasion.

mobs.long_desc: A little ugly fish swims around here.
mobs.desc: This fish is hideous.  It is doubtful that it has any flavor at all to it.

mobs.keywords: information info desk-clerk clerk man stout
mobs.long_desc: A man prepared to give out directions stands here.
mobs.desc: This stout man with nicely fitting attire attends his information desk.  The kindly man is ready to help those in need, and is eager to answer even the most stupid questions.

mobs.long_desc: A monk with a high education is standing here.
mobs.desc: Of all the monks in the abbey, this one is the most educated looking.  It is uncanny how brilliant he appears.

mobs.long_desc: A dedicated young man is here working very hard.
mobs.desc: A dedicated, hard working young man walks around assuring order in his surroundings.  His tasks include cleaning up the when there is a mess, and also he has a strict study regiment to follow.

mobs.long_desc: A man from a neighboring priesthood is here.
mobs.desc: This man is from a different, nearby order.  He has come here to this abbey to exchange culture and knowledge with these monks.

mobs.long_desc: A monk heavily involved in his studies is here.
mobs.desc: This monk is quite dedicated to bettering himself.  He has worked long, hard hours learning from the large number of texts to be found in the library, and obviously intends to be well informed about the world.

mobs.long_desc: A former criminal walks around here cleansing himself.
mobs.desc: This middle aged formal criminal is in the abbey for one reason, to rid himself of his former ways.  Never has crime paid for this man, and he has set himself to change his life.

mobs.long_desc: The doctor of the abbey makes his rounds here.
mobs.desc: The doctor is a middle-aged human man with short cut black hair and a weathered but maintained appearance.  He wears a simple robe like the other monks of the abbey, indicating his membership in the brotherhood of St.  George.  Unlike his brothers, he also wears a shawl with a red cross on either tail, signifying his unique position amongst the monastery's residents.  His countenance is firm yet compassionate, his bedside manner pleasant and warm.  He is quite renowned for his skills at group healing.

mobs.long_desc: A masked bandit raider sits on a pile of stolen loot.
mobs.desc: From the long coat and dual scimitars, it's immediately obvious this is the Desert Devil.  Masked and wearing a wide-brimmed hat, it's nearly impossible to make out much of the facial features of this individual.  You can only make out the sharp, angry eyes of this legendary raider, eyes that pierce through heart as sharply as any dagger.  Terrifyingly fast and deadly, the Desert Devil is more than a match for any opponent.  Many have tried to bring them to justice; all have failed.  Will today be your lucky day?

mobs.long_desc: A highly learned man walks about here.
mobs.desc: A man who has many years of education is here, wandering around.  He has small spectacles that would probably break if looked through for too long a period of time.

mobs.long_desc: A wiry old man seems upset over the untidy bookshelves.
mobs.desc: Disorder and a lacking of straightened shelves constantly harass this librarian.  His hours are long and probably tiresome, yet he works now as diligently as ever.

mobs.long_desc: An overworked, under appreciated man toils over some papers.
mobs.desc: The stress of this man is apparent in his face.  His skin is old beyond his age.  The aquisitor is working as diligently as is possible with his resources. Quality items are scarce, and he seems troubled that one item in particular has been misplaced.

mobs.long_desc: A man is reclined here gazing at a picture in his mind.
mobs.desc: This man has taken solace in these quiet, docile surroundings.  He lays on his side sketching all the wonderful pictures of his imagination, trying to escape some past torment.  He is a large man, tall and muscular, even though he is slouched over his drawings.

mobs.long_desc: Silania, the Righteous, floats here with her eyes beaming.
mobs.desc: This woman floating here is Silania, the Righteous.  Her heart is filled with radiant goodness, causing light to spew fourth engulfing the surroundings. She is simply dressed in pure, white robes flowing down to her feet.  There are told rumors that some can cure with a simple touch, and Silania no doubt is capable of such a feat.  As a reward for all of her goodness, Silania has been gifted with extraordinary powers, coming from the most holy sources imaginable.

objects.ground: A white garment lies in a heap.

extras.text: The vestment is pure white in colour, and upon the left breast, there is the symbol of the Holy Brotherhood of St.  George.

objects.ground: A freshly baked loaf of bread tantalizes your tastebuds.

extras.text: The bread is well baked, and its tantalising aroma makes your mouth water. This loaf is a gourmet's delight.

objects.ground: A tankard of ale is here.

extras.text: This is a small tin mug which is usually found in alehouses.

objects.ground: A white vestment is here.

extras.text: The vestment is made of the finest white silk you have ever seen.  There is a symbol of the Brotherhood of St.  George on the left breast, but the vestment has gold trimmings on the sleeves.

objects.ground: A heavily decorated staff rests against the wall.

extras.text: Engraved all around the staff are runes of power of mystical origins.  A gentle light seems to radiate from the very apex of this staff, which seems to be quite bright. Words seems to dance before your eyes as you intently study this artifact. They read: May the pure be lead by the light.

objects.ground: A great tome is before you.

extras.text: Before you is the great Book of Discipline.  Written in it are the teachings of the great St.  George, to whom this monastery is dedicated to.  It is said that great wisdom is held by the tome.

objects.ground: A maul lies on the ground.

extras.text: A large and heavy maul, this has the potential to severely hurt anybody who gets in its way.

objects.ground: A piece of waybread is here.

extras.text: The waybread may not look too appetising, but it would sustain you in times of hardship.  The fact this it is almost as hard as rock doesn't help it go down well with your tender stomach.

objects.ground: A slimy, uncooked filet lies here getting dirty.

extras.text: An utterly disgusting bit of uncooked fish is all that remains of a once truely unsightly flounder.

objects.ground: The yellow robe of a scholar lies here.

extras.text: This robe is in high quality, and quite fashionable.  There are small golden tassles hanging from the lining, making it seem very unique.

objects.ground: A pair of little spectacles rests here.

extras.text: These spectacles are small and likely used for reading.  They have an odd and unique hexagonal frame around the glass portions, but look strong and well-used.

objects.ground: A short, bronze colored chalice sits here in the corner absorbing light.

extras.text: This small, bronze chalice seems to pick up the light from a room and collect it.  The lip is slightly rounded, making drinking from it easy.  There is one small jewel embedded in the base, glowing slightly.  It appears to be a beloved item from elsewhere in the land.

objects.ground: A large wooden crate marked with a red cross stands off to the side here.

extras.text: The words "Property of the Monastery of St. George" is stenciled on the side of the crate.  It looks to be full of bandages, ointments, unguents, and other medical supplies.

objects.short: the Rite of the Heroes' Feast
objects.ground: A small book of sacred recipes has been concealed by the rubble.

extras.text: Long lost in the Northern Swamp, this collection of rituals and recipes is an instruction manual for a sacred rite called the Heroes' Feast.  The language of the instructions and the types of ingredients are hundreds of years old.

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a note from a chef.

extras.text: There are several notes from the Frakati chef on how to best prepare meat.

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a note from a chef.

extras.text: Random squiggles and letters criss cross several pages.  They seem to suggest something about sauces?

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a note from a chef.

extras.text: These are several notes from the abbey's chef on ancient desserts.

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a note from a chef.

extras.text: There are several notes from the Ogakh mess hall chef Dugrik on how to stretch a stew.

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a note from a chef.

extras.text: There are several notes from an old book on unusual drink recipes.

objects.ground: Someone has dropped a note from a chef.

extras.text: There are several notes from Rianne d' Argent on appetizers and spice substitutions.

objects.short: a package of food and medicine
objects.ground: A brown paper package tied up with string lays tossed aside by a group of children.

extras.text: This package contains a little bit of the miraculous Heroes' Feast prepared by the abbeys doctor.  Included with the food is a first aid kit and several instruments more surgical in nature.

objects.short: a handful of grave dirt from the Graveyard
objects.ground: Some very haunted dirt is piled up here.

extras.text: This is a handful of greatly unhallowed dirt taken from the Graveyard near Anduin.

objects.short: a handful of grave dirt from the Cathedral of Betrayal
objects.ground: Some black rocky dirt is piled up here.

extras.text: This is a handful of rocky black dirt taken from the Cathedral of Betrayal.

objects.short: a handful of grave dirt from the Gothra Pyramid
objects.ground: Some yellow sandy earth is piled up here.

extras.text: This is a handful of sandy dirt taken from the large pyramid in the Gothra Desert.

objects.short: a handful of grave dirt from the Barrow
objects.ground: Some iron-red dirt is piled up here.

extras.text: This is a handful of iron-rich reddish dirt taken from the large barrow in the Iron Hills.

objects.ground: A sturdy hand shovel stands impaled in the dirt.

extras.text: Instead of gardens, this well-worn hand shovel has been used to turn the earth over hundreds, if not thousands of graves.  It bears a red cross on white shield, the mark of the Abbey of St.  George west of the Mielikki farmlands.

objects.ground: A font of holy water stands near the altar.

extras.text: This font is a simple short pillar of white and gray marble with a square capital.  A circular basin is carved into the top of the capital.  An inscription around the capital dedicates the font to St.  George, the patron saint of the abbey.  The font is otherwise unadorned and perfectly smooth.

objects.ground: An ornate silver flask filled with holy water stands nearby.

extras.text: The flask is adorned with a benediction from the gods of the upper realms.

objects.ground: A blazingly bright key sparkles in the light here.

extras.text: The sun key almost looks like half a key.  If it were, the twin copy of it would be just backwards, yet equally glittery.

objects.ground: A dimming bright key sparkles in the light here.

extras.text: The setting sun key almost looks like half a key.  If it were, the twin copy of it would be just backwards, yet equally glittery.

objects.ground: An apparently misplaced key lies here.

extras.text: The Prior, having some unexpected reasoning dispute with the monks regarding the ancient texts of the library, has decided to lock a few rooms holding the more important documents and literary works.

objects.ground: A dough-covered brass key lies here.

extras.text: This key has once been lost.  The miller is probably looking everywhere for it. The specks of dough on it make it seem like it has been misplaced before.

objects.ground: A sturdy oak desk occupies a corner of this room.

extras.text: Pushed up into a corner, this large desk occupies a large portion of the open space of this room.  There are piles of papers on top as well as some books. What is more interesting is the small key hole that is hidden in the side of the desk.

objects.ground: A box in poor condition lies here gathering dust.

extras.text: This scruffy-looking small wooden box sits here holding its secrets.

objects.ground: A long, tied piece of rope lies on the ground here.

extras.text: This belt made from rope is very plain and simlistic.  Just the kind of thing a monk would wear.

triggers.name: anti_dia_necro_subclass_prior_head_death
triggers.commands: * Subclass drop trigger set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% == 3 set drophead 1 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[nec_dia_ant_subclass]% == 3 set drophead 1 endif if %drophead% == 1 mload obj 8504 endif

triggers.name: silania_welcome
triggers.commands: wait 2 switch %actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You've returned!  Let's talk about your &6&bquest&0.' break case 2 case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Have you returned with the bronze chalice the diabolists stole?' break default if %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes set maxlevel 25 done elseif %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie set classgreet no break default set classgreet yes set maxlevel 35 done endif if %classgreet% == yes if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= %maxlevel% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Some know not of their &6&bdestinies&0, others simply choose to ignore them.  Which of the two are you?' wait 2 ponder %actor.name% endif endif done if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask3]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Oh good, you're all set!  Let me see the staff.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need for the %weapon%?' endif endif endif endif if %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% eval minlevel %macestep% * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I sense a ghostly presence about your weapons.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need?' endif endif endif

triggers.name: quest_preamble_silania
triggers.commands: if (%speech% /= destiny || %speech% /= destinies || %speech% /= destiny? || %speech% /= destinies? || %speech% /= I know) && !%actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% if %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to priest.&0 halt endif break default set classquest yes done elseif %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to paladin.&0 halt endif break default set classquest yes done else if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sorry, I cannot help you achieve your destiny.' endif endif endif wait 2 if %classquest% == yes if %use_subclass% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I am currently helping another supplicant, one moment my child.'' halt endif if %actor.align% > 349 if %actor.class% /= Warrior && %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 nod %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do ye wish to join the ranks of the holy warriors?' set use_subclass Pal global use_subclass elseif %actor.class% /= Cleric && %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 nod %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do ye wish to join the ranks of the priests and help drive darkness from our world?' set use_subclass Pri global use_subclass elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I appreciate your aspiring virtue.  Come and see me once you've gained more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are already following your destiny.  I cannot help you any further.' endif else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I cannot help you if you are not good, little one.' endif endif

triggers.name: start_quest_silania
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to priest.&0 halt endif break default if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 set classquest yes elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I appreciate your virtue.  Come and see me once you've gained more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are already following your destiny.  I cannot help you any further.' endif done endif if %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to paladin.&0 halt endif break default if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 set classquest yes elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I appreciate your virtue.  Come and see me once you've gained more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are already following your destiny.  I cannot help you any further.' endif done endif wait 2 if %classquest% == yes if %speech% /= yes if %actor.align% > 349 && !%actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% if !%use_subclass% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'First, we must discuss your destiny.' else quest start pri_pal_subclass %actor.name% %use_subclass% smile %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You may check your &6&b[subclass progress]&0 or ask me to &6&b[repeat]&0 myself at any time.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It is necessary to make a quest such as this quite tough to ensure ensure you really want to do this.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I am sure you will complete the &6&bquest&0 though.' endif else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I cannot help you if you are not good little one.' endif else sigh msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It is a shame we have so few willing to join us these days, but I cannot compel you.  Farewell, and I hope you come to reconsider your decision sometime.' wait 2 msend %actor% Silania makes a gesture with her hand and you are blinded for a second. mechoaround %actor% Silania makes a gesture with her hand and %actor.name% disappears. mteleport %actor% 18566 endif unset use_subclass endif

triggers.name: quest_details_silania
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% == 1 quest advance pri_pal_subclass %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'At this abbey we have always permitted any person to wander freely.' wait 1s ponder wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Well, not if they are evily aligned, but otherwise...' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'One of our guests made off with our most sacred bronze chalice.' steam wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'We have reason to believe it was a ruse by the filthy diabolists to try and weaken us.  Our Prior has offered to try and retrieve it for us, but...' wait 2 think msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I think perhaps that would be a bad idea and that you should find it instead.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Good luck, your quest has begun!' bow endif

triggers.name: give_chalice_silania
triggers.commands: wait 2 * stage is set to 3 when chalice retrieved if %actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% == 3 emote beams a huge smile. wait 3 hug %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have done me a great service, and earned your place among the truly holy.' smi wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Type &7&b'subclass'&0 to proceed.' quest complete pri_pal_subclass %actor.name% elseif %actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% == 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hmmm, jumping the gun a bit aren't we?' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I didn't even tell you the quest yet.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Thank you greatly for returning this.' thank %actor.name% wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% == 2 * hmm..they got the chalice without running the appropriate trigger * could they be cheating? msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hmm... I don't know how you got hold of this, but I will give you the benefit of the doubt and not fail you.' poke %actor.name% wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Now... go and get the chalice properly yourself!' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Shame you were not performing the quest.  Your selfless act would have qualified you for our holy brotherhood.' endif endif *junk the chalice mjunk chalice

triggers.name: exit_from_silania
triggers.commands: say Ooops, how embarassing, I forgot about the door! m_run_room_trig 18507

triggers.name: create_door_18547_to_18566
triggers.commands: * only run from silanias trigger 18506 wait 2 wecho The walls seem to flow away from an opening. wdoor 18547 east room 18566 wdoor 18566 west room 18547

triggers.name: close_door_18547_to_18566
triggers.commands: wait 5 set closeit 0 if %direction% /= east if %self.vnum% == 18547 set closeit 1 endif endif if %direction% /= west if %self.vnum% == 18566 set closeit 1 endif endif if %closeit% == 1 wecho The walls seem to flow together behind you, sealing the entrance! wdoor 18547 east purge wdoor 18566 west purge endif

triggers.name: Priest_Paladin_Subclass_Quest_Silania_Status
triggers.commands: wait 2 switch %actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You want to join the holy ranks of priests and paladins.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It is necessary to make a quest such as this quite tough to ensure you really want to do this.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I am sure you will complete the &6&bquest&0 though.' break case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'This is your quest to join the ranks of priests and paladins.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'One of our guests made off with our most sacred bronze chalice.' steam wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'We have reason to believe it was a ruse by the filthy diabolists to try and weaken us.  Our Prior has offered to try and retrieve it for us, but...' wait 2 think msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I think perhaps that would be a bad idea and that you should find it instead.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Good luck, your quest has begun!' bow break case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Have you found the bronze chalice the diabolists stole?' break default if %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to priest.&0 halt endif break default set check yes done elseif %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% case drow case faerie_unseelie if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to paladin.&0 halt endif break default set check yes done endif done if %check% == yes if (%actor.class% /= Warrior && %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25) || (%actor.class% /= Cleric && %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35) msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are not working to join the holy order.' elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I appreciate your aspiring virtue.  Come and see me once you've gained more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are already following your destiny.  I cannot help you any further.' endif endif

triggers.name: abbot_rand1
triggers.commands: fume say Not another blackmail note about my prior. emote rips up a letter into tiny pieces. stomp

triggers.name: abbot_speak1
triggers.commands: peer %actor.name% say Anything you heard about Berack is pure hearsay. sigh say That young man has enough to worry about without people bringing up his family all the time.

triggers.name: abbot_rand2
triggers.commands: emote mutters about the tribulations of monastic life. sigh

triggers.name: chalice_retrieval
triggers.commands: if %self.room% == 8591 * we are in chalice room so set the quest bit if %actor.quest_stage[pri_pal_subclass]% == 2 if %already_got% == 1 oechoaround %actor% The chalice slips from %actor.p% fingers! osend %actor% The chalice slips from your fingers! return 0 else quest advance pri_pal_subclass %actor.name% endif endif set already_got 1 global already_got endif

triggers.name: chalice_dropped
triggers.commands: * if the chalice is dropped it could be some1 trying to get round * the GET trigger...this should prevent that oecho the DROP trigger for %self.name% is RUNNING

triggers.name: almoner_give_food
triggers.commands: set victim %random.char% if (%victim.vnum% == -1) && (%victim.level% < 25) && (%victim.can_be_seen%) smile %victim.name% say Hello there, young one.  You look like you could use a bite to eat. mjunk waybread mload obj 18508 give waybread %victim.name% endif

triggers.name: group_heal_doctor_greet

triggers.commands: wait 2 nod mecho %self.name% says, 'I specialize in group healing.  It's a powerful spell mecho &0involving complex prayers.  Not easy to learn.' if ((%actor.class% /= Cleric || %actor.class% /= Priest || %actor.class% /= Diabolist) && %actor.level% > 56) && %actor.quest_stage[group_heal]% == 0 wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'But you look like a very capable healer! Interesting! break case 2 say That looks like a very reasonable suggestion! break case 3 say Oh so that's what that thing is called now... break default say I see how this works! done endif if %total% == 6 mjunk notes quest advance group_heal %actor.name% wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'That looks like everything!  May I have that copy of the Rite mecho &0please?' else wait 1s say Please, bring me the notes on the rest of the rite! endif endif elseif %stage% == 6 if %object.vnum% == 18514 quest variable group_heal %actor.name% total 0 wait 2 mjunk heroes-feast wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'I think I can put this together now!! Bring them succor with those packages.' wait 4s say Except for Lirne. wait 2 grumble wait 2s say He needs to learn his lesson eventually. wait 4s say May St. George ever smile upon your endeavors! wait 2 wave %actor.name% else return 0 say I'm afraid this won't be of much use to me right now. msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. endif else return 0 say I'm afraid this won't be of much use to me right now. msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. endif

triggers.commands: return 0 if %object.vnum% == 18514 && %actor.quest_stage[group_heal]% == 5 if %actor.quest_variable[group_heal:%self.vnum%]% if %self.vnum% == 50203 msend %actor% %self.name% moans and swats your hand away. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% moans and swats %actor.name%'s hand away. elseif %self.vnum% == 51007 cackle %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% inches away from you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% inches away from %actor.name%. else say I've told you everything I can. Looks like quite a meal. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Roasting methods may be a little difficult to control. mecho &0I can share with you some methods the Frakati people use to prepare and roast mecho &0wild game.' wait 4s emote writes down several notes. wait 3s mload obj 18515 give notes %actor.name% wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'These small tips will make sure your meats stay tender mecho &0and juicy while soaking up as much flavor as possible.' wait 2s say Good luck. break case 51007 * the crazy chef emote begins to run in a circle laughing hysterically. wait 4s emote stops running and starts writing. wait 2s mecho %self.name% keeps laughing and writing... wait 2s mecho ... and writing... wait 2s mecho ... and writing... wait 2s mecho ... and writing... wait 4s mload obj 18516 give notes %actor.name% laugh %actor.name% break case 18512 * a scruffy cook mecho %self.name% says, 'Well what is this? Visit the Cleric Guild Master in the Arctic Village of Ickle mecho &0and talk to High Priest Zalish.  He should be able to help you.' break case 4 mecho %self.name% says, 'Continue with the Cleric Guild Masters.  Check in mecho &0with the High Priestess in the City of Anduin.' break case 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'Sometimes to battle the dead, we need to use their mecho &0own dark natures against them.  Few are as knowledgeable about the dark mecho &0arts as Ziijhan, the Defiler, in the Cathedral of Betrayal.' break case 6 mecho %self.name% says, 'Return again to the Abbey of St. George and seek out mecho &0Silania.  Her mastry of spiritual matters will be necessary to improve mecho &0this mace any further.' break case 7 mecho %self.name% says, 'Of the few remaining who are capable of improving your mecho &0mace, one is a priest of a god most foul.  Find Ruin Wormheart, that mecho &0most heinous of Blackmourne's servators.' break case 8 mecho %self.name% says, 'The most powerful force in the war against the dead mecho &0is the sun itself. * drop a gem from the next wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55593 mload obj %gem_vnum% endif elseif (%will_drop% >=61 &%will_drop% <= 80) * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop destroyed armor 55299 is the vnum before the * first piece of armor. eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55319 mload obj %armor_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop armor from the current wear pos set eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55323 mload obj %armor_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop a piece of armor from next wear pos eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55327 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif else * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop armor and gem from previous wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55585 eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55319 mload obj %gem_vnum% mload obj %armor_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop a gem and armor from the current wear pos set eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55323 mload obj %armor_vnum% eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55589 mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop armor and gem from next wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55593 mload obj %gem_vnum% eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55327 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif endif

rooms.name: Dusty Path
rooms.description: The gatehouse to a large, highly decorated monastery lies west along this path.  There is a small building which appears to have been tacked onto the main abbey complex just south of here, while there are fields distantly east.

rooms.name: Outside the Gatehouse
rooms.description: The gatehouse to the monastery of the Brotherhood of Tisus the Benevolent. There are heavy wooden doors leading within to the south, into the eroding marble building.  The wrath of the elements has taken its toll on the building, especially the brutal winds that sweep passed here from the fields to the east.

South.description: The heavy wooden doors are badly scarred, as if it had at one time been the subject of an assault. But in spite of that, it is still very sturdy.

rooms.name: The Sacristy
rooms.description: The sacrist does not seem to be here at the moment, though he left the tools of his trade behind.  A large book has been placed on his desk, documenting the many funerals that have taken place here over the years.  To the east is the main, common area of the church.

rooms.name: The Cemetery
rooms.description: Large marble tombstones lie in neat rows through this cemetery.  It is utterly silent.  The grass is short and trimmed, the spaces between each stone is perfectly suited for even the tallest of individuals.  The cemetery continues on to the south.

rooms.name: The Almonry
rooms.description: This particular almonry is in poor condition and the thick dust could make breathing difficult for some.  Jars line the shelves around the room filled graciously by the monks of the abbey with grains and sugar to be given to weary travellers as alms.  The almonry is so small that there only seems to be a lone exit, to the north.

rooms.name: Abbey Gatehouse
rooms.description: The gatehouse of the abbey seems well fitted to stand up to any assualt that any barbarians might launch.  Only a powerful assualt by a large force could break through the incredibly thick walls of the gatehouse.  The elements of the world swirl around through the thick oak doors to the north or through to the south into the insides of the abbey itself.

North.description: The wooden doors look quite sturdy from this side of the wall. The monks seem to take quite good care of it.

rooms.name: Stables
rooms.description: The stench of stabled animals is nearly overwhelming.  There are large bales of hay stacked in a corner, and would be rather warm and inviting to rest in, if it were possible to overcome the rank odor.  There are pack animals and fine beasts of burden here awaiting the return of their masters from the south.

rooms.name: The Bell Tower
rooms.description: Just below is the inside of the church, which is what this large bell calls people to.  It would appear that the sound which would come from such a large bell could be heard for miles in all directions.  The vantage point that this tower provides gives an open view of much of the surrounding countryside.

rooms.name: The Altar
rooms.description: Of any church around this is possibly the most delicate and also most beautiful.  The decorations are stunning, and they are wonderfully highlighted by the soft glow of candle light around the room.  The altar has been moved to a position on the west side of the large, open room, facing the door way. Next to the altar is a passage leading to an adjoining room.  East there are the doors to the church leading to the outside and less beautiful surroundings.

extras.text: A large marble edifice of the patron saint of this monastery is placed at the centre of the altar. He has a kindly and wise face, and he holds a large tome in his hand.

rooms.name: The Cemetery
rooms.description: Large marble tombstones lie in neat rows through this cemetery.  It is utterly silent.  The grass is short and trimmed, the spaces between each stone is perfectly suited for even the tallest of individuals.  There is a small path east leading away from this place back towards the main abbey grounds.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: There are many small trees lining this small, worn dirt path towards the west to the cemetery.  Further south is the covered walkway with a number of monks working.

rooms.name: Outer Courtyard
rooms.description: The outer courtyard of this abbey is rather well maintained, even though open to the elements.  The brick that line the walk ways have only just begun to crumble, making it pretty easy to walk on.  There is the large gatehouse to the north, or the path continues on to the guest chambers passed the remainder of the courtyard east.

rooms.name: Outer Courtyard
rooms.description: Directly east is the abbey's guest house.  The eastern part of the outer courtyard is in just as good of shape as the section of courtyard to the west of here.  Just south is a trite little archaic archway leading to the interior of the abbey.

rooms.name: Guest House
rooms.description: The monks of this abbey take wonderful care of their guests, as is noticable in these guest quarters.  There are dazzling decorations about the room and a hot sparkling fire in the fireplace.  There is an elegant circular staircase in the corner leading up to the sleeping chambers, or the exit back towards the abbey west through a door that is probably never closed.

extras.text: You can't resist the temptation to warm your hands on the fire. It feels good as the warmth creeps up your hand.

rooms.name: Guest Chambers
rooms.description: There are many beautiful aspects to this bed chamber.  The monks certainly have all the amenities that a king might expect available for their visitors. A large bed draped in scarlet sheets is against the north wall.  The four corner posts are connected to each other with translucent silk drapes.  The room is in immaculate condition, much like the rest of the abbey.

rooms.name: Church Entrance
rooms.description: There is a magnificent building looming ahead.  It has graceful buttresses and its beautiful stained glass windows are a sight to behold.  The covered walkway extends to the east, and the church stands to the west.

rooms.name: Chapter House
rooms.description: This room is large, with a high vaulted, spacious feeling.  There is a large circular table in the center, dominating the room.  Lined on the walls there are rows and rows of books and other documents, making this a room filled with a wealth of knowledge.  South is the covered walkway.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: There are many small trees lining this small, worn dirt path towards the north to the cemetery.  Just south is the covered walkway with a number of monks working.

rooms.name: The Abbot's Lodgings
rooms.description: This is a quaint little cottage which houses the abbot.  The single large room that is obvious is well furnished compared to the rest of the housings around the abbey.  There are books lining the shelves all around, with a large writing desk under the window looking back south onto a small path and the inner courtyard.

extras.text: Arranged on the desk are stacks of sealed letters. It seems like this abbey gets quite a lot of correspondence.

rooms.name: Arched Pathway
rooms.description: A simple, yet quite old archway connects the outer courtyard to the inner courtyard.  There once was a gate stretched between the two, but is has long been removed, though there are still traces of where it once had been on the northern side near the outer courtyard.

extras.text: The words upon the arch reads: Fiat Justitia, ruat coelum

rooms.name: The Kitchen
rooms.description: The floor of this kitchen seems particularly worn down, almost as if it were a high traffic area.  There are loaves of fresh bread on the shelves above, and boiling pots of other assorted foods over the flames.  East there is a deep, baritone voice moving through the air mixing in well with the sounds of the kitchen.

extras.text: You dip your finger in the pot and get a taste. It tastes quite okay, but you realise that it isn't something that would exactly tantalise the taste buds.
The bread smells delicious, but it is too far for you to grab hold of.

rooms.name: The Refectory
rooms.description: There are long rows of tables and benches extending the width of this room. There is a monk at the pulpit just to the south.  Reciting words from a large, worn down text.  Compared to the ruckus of the kitchen west, the atmosphere here is very tame and solemn.

rooms.name: The Dormitory
rooms.description: Simple beds with thin mattresses are arranged along the walls.  There seems to be a constant draft in here, but there is no sign of blankets on any of the beds.  It would seem that these monks take their vows very seriously.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues east and south, with church west and some dormitories north.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues east and west.  The chapel is to the north and there is a small patch of lawn south.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues west and south, and a small dirt path is north of here.

rooms.name: Quiet Path
rooms.description: This is a small little serene path leading east and west between the inner courtyard and a longer covered walkway.  The is a small cottage north that seems elegant in its simplicity.  South there is a strong aroma of freshly baked bread wafting in this direction.

rooms.name: Inner Courtyard
rooms.description: There is a relaxed sense of tranquillity here.  Unlike the more noisy and active outer courtyard, it is quite docile here among the various buildings of the abbey.  There are small paths leading off west and south, while the courtyard itself continues east.  There is also a way back towards the outer courtyard to the north.

rooms.name: Inner Courtyard
rooms.description: There is a delicious smell wafting in from the north.  It is an unusual mix of roasting fire and cooking that infiltrates the senses.  The courtyard moves off back to the west, or there is what definately does smell like a kitchen north.

rooms.name: The Pulpit
rooms.description: From this pulpit a man lectures at his fellow monks as they dine.  It is practice for them to all reaffirm their faith and beliefs at each meal, while also being reminded of their duties for good and order and helping those in need.

rooms.name: The Infirmary
rooms.description: There are beds arranged in neat rows along the side walls.  Beside each bed there is a small jug for water for the patients.  There is a strongly pungent odor of some kind of herbal mixture floating around the room.  East is the covered walkway and healthy monks working on various projects.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues north and south, with a small patch of lawn east and the abbey's infirmary to the west.

rooms.name: The Lawn
rooms.description: This is a small bit of lawn surrounded on all sides by a quiet covered path. The grass is green, and probably is year round.  There are monks all about working on their tasks.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues north and south, and the small patch of lawn is west.

rooms.name: The Bakehouse
rooms.description: There is quite a large number of baked goods lining the shelves around.  In the center of the room is the dominatingly large oven.  The bakers have apparently taken making their bread to a new level as the smell is wonderful, extending out onto the quiet path north and further beyond that.

extras.text: Well, it's bread. What do you expect it to look like?

rooms.name: Shaded Path
rooms.description: This nice shady path is quiet and relaxing.  The Prior's residence is directly east of this spot, while north is the inner courtyard and south the Shaded Path continues.  The trees on either side of this walk way really add to the feeling of serenity.

rooms.name: Prior's Lodgings
rooms.description: The abbey's prior resides within this room.  The entire room is neat and spaciously decorated.  There are a few small stacks of books and various documents on the desk in perfectly aligned piles.  There is but one exit from these lodgings to the west.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues north and east from here.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues east and west, with a small patch of lawn north.

rooms.name: Covered Walkway
rooms.description: This is a small square-shaped, covered walkway surrounding a green lawn. Around the outer portions of the square there are small work benches and stools.  The walkway continues west and north, and just south is a small path to a garden.

rooms.name: The Mill
rooms.description: Everything that would be needed to make bread is in this building.  There are huge stacks of grain on one wall, and some already crushed flour on another.  There is machinery, the center piece of which is a large grinding stone, lining the back wall causing quite a bit of noise.  The only exit from the facility is back to the east through some trees.

extras.text: The array of machinery and gears are beyond your ability to understand. But you can see that it is quite efficient at grinding the grain.

rooms.name: Shaded Path
rooms.description: The trees planted on either side of this path almost obscure the two buildings on either side.  There is a grinding sound emanating from the west with a light clunking sound from the east.  Otherwise, this path continues to a small bridge south and on to the north.

West.description: The building has a large waterwheel attached to it's southern face. The sound of gears running can be heard quite distinctly there.

rooms.name: The Brewhouse
rooms.description: There is a variety of implements for making wine and other alcoholic drinks around this small building.  On one of the larger walls there are stacks of beverage casks for holding the minted brews.  There is a small path obscured by some trees to the west.

extras.text: Unfortunately, the casks are still empty. Looks like you can't get a free drink.

rooms.name: The Herb Garden
rooms.description: The amount of herbs crowded into such a small plot of such well tended land is incredible.  It is apparent that this is where all the seasonings for the bakery and kitchen come from.

rooms.name: The Herb Garden
rooms.description: The amount of herbs crowded into such a small plot of such well tended land is incredible.  It is appreant that this is where all the seasonings for the bakery and kitchen come from.

rooms.name: Small Path
rooms.description: This is a small, desolate path, connecting an artificial fishing pond to some herb gardens to the west.  The covered walkway is to the north where some monks are working on various projects.

rooms.name: The Fish Pond
rooms.description: This is a small, man-made pond made solely for raising fish for the abbey. The mill can be seen to the north, though it is inaccessible from here.  There is a garden to the west some distance.

extras.text: As you peer into the pond, you can see fish of all shapes and sizes swimming around. You try to catch one, but you are just not fast enough.

rooms.name: Inside Silania's Chambers
rooms.description: These chambers are nicely, if sparcely, decorated.  There is a long tapestry on the wall, and a small window allowing air to flow in.  The floors are bare and clean, and there is a small mat before a shrine.  A tapered candle rises on a stand in each of the four corners of this room, casting light across the entire room.

rooms.name: Under the Setting Sun
rooms.description: This small little room hidden beneath the glowing room of the setting sun. It is equal in all respects to the room above.  The light filters in especially nicely during the later evening hours, as this room is right down near the ground.  The only exit is back up a small ladder to the setting sun room.

Up.description: Dust rains down on you from above.

rooms.name: A Small Alcove
rooms.description: There is not much to this room.  It is simple and small.  The walls are barren and there does not seem to be any practical use for it even being here. It could have once been a storage area for people sitting in the room of the setting sun while they relaxed.  The one exit lies to the north.

North.description: The wall looks like it can be moved.

rooms.name: Small Bridge
rooms.description: This is a small stone bridge running between the main abbey and the library. The rock which makes up this bridge is becoming degraded as time wears on, much of that having to do with the high volume of foot traffic traveling on this path.  The main abbey to the north extends high above the ground, and is matched in size equally by the library to the south.

rooms.name: Outside the Library
rooms.description: This is the outside of the library building.  The skies extend above you far and wide, and the steps of the library are to the south.  The entire building is large and complex in its simplicity.  Though the years of wind and rain have been cruel at times, the building is still in remarkable condition.  A small gate stands to the west, beyond which is a simple dirt road that runs off into the hills.

rooms.name: Outside the Library
rooms.description: The outside in front of the library is as plain as the building which stands to the south.  The abbey, back to the north, can be reached by crossing a small stone bridge.  Above there is a bit of open sky that almost seems to be calling to the birds.  As it is now, those skies are empty, and all that is noticable is the looming library building.

rooms.name: Outside the Library
rooms.description: There is greatness in literature, and the library to the south is rich in words.  The size of the building is incredible, matched by the abbey to the north.  Above is open sky, practically devoid of everything.  There is not even a simple cloud or a single bird to make it more occupied.

rooms.name: Library Steps
rooms.description: The large marble steps leading to the entrance of the library are truely rare.  The marble must have been hauled a great distance to be here in such a pure form.  Just east is the entrance to the library, while there is also path way off to the north.

rooms.name: Library Entrance
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the library.  Beyond to the south lies a great wealth of knowledge, while the steps are around to the east and west leading up to here.  The large oak doors loom high and wide protecting the delicate insides of the library from damage.

rooms.name: Library Steps
rooms.description: The large marble steps leading to the entrance of the library are truely rare.  The marble must have been hauled a great distance to be here in such a pure form.  Just west is the entrance to the library, while there is also path way to the north.

rooms.name: Large Statue
rooms.description: There is a large statue dominating this room.  It only adds to the rich texture of the library which houses it.  Some how the lighting of this room has been manipulated to shine in just such a way onto this solid embodiment of a true creator and visionary as to bring out all of its sharp contours and features.

extras.text: This large statue is shaped after the founding monk of this library.  His memory is served well, in the strong expression on his face.  His personal inner strength shows through the hard stone which embodies him.

rooms.name: Foyer
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the magnificent library.  The building extends far to the south, there is a multitude of texts on all the shelves.  The exit from the library lies to the north on down some large marble steps.  There are rich tapestries hanging from the walls, probably made by some of the hard working monks of the abbey.

rooms.name: Lounge
rooms.description: This lounge is just a small area for some temporary relaxation before entering the majority of the library.  The foyer is to the west, but many of the library's patrons choose to remain in this room in the comfortable furniture and read.

rooms.name: Information Desk
rooms.description: The information desk dominates this part of the library.  There are informational notices posted on a bulletin board, and people milling about working hard and sorting some of the books to be reshelved.  The library continues to the south, and north is the foyer followed by the exit.

rooms.name: Bottom of Staircase
rooms.description: There is a small staircase here, leading above.  North is a lounge with some of the library patrons reading some books.  There is little light here; not even much filters down from the rooms above.

rooms.name: Hidden Staircase
rooms.description: There is a small staircase here, leading above.  South is a small passage leading to some stacks of books.  There is little light in here, not even much filters down from the rooms above.

rooms.name: Librarian's Office
rooms.description: This is the head librarian's office.  From here there are stacks of papers piled all around.  There is an old, leather bound book lying open on the chair which is pushed out from under the desk a ways.  There seems to be some dust collected on some of the shelves, badly in need of dusting.  The inner library is to the east.

rooms.name: Inside the Library
rooms.description: The insides of the library continue on from here.  To the south the stacks begin, shelved high with many old books.  West of here is the main office, and east is a garden for some relaxation, making it a nice place to sit back and read.  The information desk lies to the north, and the library's exit beyond.

rooms.name: Hidden Staircase
rooms.description: This is a small, hidden staircase leading down into a map room.  There is not much to the staircase.  It is small, round and simple.  There are some book stacks south.

rooms.name: The Holy Cross End of the Stacks
rooms.description: This is a section of long rows of books, stacked extremely high on shelves. The books vary in size from small religious texts to huge bindings of maps. The stacks are here, and continue to the east.  Just south of here is a small study, and north is a small, slightly concealed passage.  There is a very large cross on the wall to the west, seeming to dominate the entire portion of wall.

extras.text: The cross is very large and highly decorated.  It seems to glow brightly, casting warmth upon those who get captured in its light.  Before the cross is a small mat.

rooms.name: Stacks
rooms.description: This is a section of long rows of books, stacked extremely high on shelves. The books vary in size from small religious texts to huge bindings of maps. The stacks are here, and continue east and west.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Stacks
rooms.description: This is the beginning of long rows of books, stacked extremely high on shelves.  The books vary in size from small religious texts to huge bindings of maps.  The stacks are here and continue east and west.  Just south of here is the cataloge, making it much easier to locate a missing book, while north leads down a passage back towards the outside.

rooms.name: Stacks
rooms.description: This is a section of long rows of books, stacked extremely high on shelves. The books vary in size from small religious texts to huge bindings of maps. The stacks are here and continue east and west.

rooms.name: Stacks
rooms.description: This is a section of long rows of books, stacked extremely high on shelves. The books vary in size from small religious texts to huge bindings of maps. The stacks are here and continue west and south, and there is a small slightly concealed staircase north.

rooms.name: Room of the Setting Sun
rooms.description: This room has one exquisit purpose.  Every evening as the sun sets the entire room glows brilliantly.  No matter the colors or time of sun set, the time is always right to use this room for reading or other activities.  There is a lone exit, east, as every other direction is made of large glass windows to allow the light in.

Down.description: One of the floorboards is scratched.

rooms.name: Study
rooms.description: This is a small, quiet study meant exclusively for reading and meditative thought.  There is a table in the middle of the room, with a few chairs around it.  Other than that, the room is blank and empty.  There are stacks to the north, and a large, beautiful room to the west, also nice for meditation and study.

rooms.name: Study
rooms.description: This is a small, quiet study meant exclusively for reading and meditative thought.  There is a table in the middle of the room, with a few chairs around it.  Other than that, the room is blank and empty.  To the east are the cataloges for locating books.

rooms.name: Catalogues
rooms.description: This is the catalogues where each book in the library is referenced.  All around there are drawers and drawers filled with reference, explaining where things are located.  There is a sign post pointing towards different locations in the library.

extras.text: The sign stands here, pointing east and west towards quiet places to study, north to the stacks, and south down a passageway leading to more stacks and offices.

rooms.name: Silent Room
rooms.description: This is a small, quiet room meant exclusively for reading and meditative thought.  There is a table in the middle of the room, with a few chairs around it.  Other than that, the room is blank and empty.  To the west are the cataloges for locating books.

rooms.name: Stacks
rooms.description: This is a section of long rows of books, stacked extremely high on shelves. The books vary in size from small religious texts to huge bindings of maps. The stacks are here, and continue north, to the east is a large, open room perfect for sitting and reading in.

rooms.name: Room of the Rising Sun
rooms.description: Many of the abbey's patrons gather in this location in the early morning hours, it is a wonderful place to relax and meditate.  There is also another benefit, the sunrise is absolutely spectacular.  The rays of sunshine pour through the room at the very first sign of light.  There are some stacks of books to the west, but otherwise the surroundings are fields and trees through the windows.

rooms.name: Toppled Stacks
rooms.description: These otherwise orderly stacks have been severely disrupted here.  It would seem that one of the stacks has fallen onto the others, in a sort of domino effect.  Once one of the stacks fell, most of the remaining ones spilled their books onto the ground.  It is much cleaner to the east where the stacks are in order.  This mess will take a long time to sort though and clear up.

rooms.name: Stacks
rooms.description: This is a section of long rows of books, stacked extremely high on shelves. The books vary in size from small religious texts to huge bindings of maps. The stacks are here, and continue west where it appears they have fallen over. To the east is a passageway leading to the remainder of the library.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: This passageway is really just a place where the stacks have been removed. There is still evidence of the shelves having been here not too long ago.  It also seems like there has been an addition to the structure to the south leading out a back way.  There are stacks to the west and some tables for open study to the east.

rooms.name: Tables
rooms.description: There are long wooden tables extending the length of the room, with chairs pushed up to it in all of the empty spots.  A few of the places are being put to use by dedicated learners.  To the west is a passageway and beyond that some more book stacks.

rooms.name: Private Stack
rooms.description: Here on the stacks of shelves are ancient books and texts.  Some of them look so frail that they would shatter with a slight breeze, let alone being handled.  Anything precious to the ancient monks of times passed was stored in this room, hidden away from all else in the land.

rooms.name: Acquisitions Office
rooms.description: It is doubtful that anyone other than the acquisitions man ever comes in this dank little back room.  It almost appears to have been put here as an afterthought, shoved in the corner of the building.  To the east is the only access to the room.

rooms.name: Back Door
rooms.description: The passageway leading in from the north ends here.  There is a small storage closet to the east that looks under used, and the head acquistions office is to the west.  The floor does not seem to have ever seen much traffic, as it is barely scuffed or worn down.

rooms.name: Storage Room
rooms.description: The storage room here is very chaotic.  There are cleaning implements scattered about.  Most of which do not appear to have been used in a very long time.  There is an exit to the west leading back into a passageway which probably does not house the dank smell that this closet does.

rooms.name: Open Air in Front of the Library
rooms.description: The air around the library is mostly clear and clean.  The building is an interesting sight from here, the stone pillars and heavy wooden doors look even more weathered than normal.  Another abbey building blocks exit north, as do trees to the west.  There is a small balcony south and more open air east.

rooms.name: Open Air in Front of the Library
rooms.description: The air around the library is mostly clear and clean.  The building is an interesting sight from here, the stone pillars and heavy wooden doors look even more weathered than normal.  There is a small balcony south and more open air east and west, and below the south part of a small stone bridge connects the abbey compound to the library.

rooms.name: Open Air in Front of the Library
rooms.description: The air around the library is mostly clear and clean.  The building is an interesting sight from here, the stone pillars and heavy wooden doors look even more weathered than normal.  Another abbey building blocks exit north, as do trees to the east.  There is a small balcony south and more open air west.

rooms.name: Balcony
rooms.description: There is open air all around, and a magnificent view of all the surrounding lands.  When it gets too windy, leaves from the trees to the west apparently find a new home resting here.  There is a large pile of them in a corner against the railing.  To the north there is open air, above the marble steps leading to the library.  The balcony extends to the east, beyond which large, outstretched fields extend.

extras.text: There is a clustered pile of leaves pushed into the corner between the western railing and the wall of the library.  They are constantly swirling about, moved by the relentless weather that pesters this entire complex.

rooms.name: Balcony
rooms.description: The stone with which this balcony was constructed above the library's entrance has been weathered by the conditions that it faces almost daily.  For some reason the wetness has played some unusual tricks on the rock, and begun eroding it prematurely.  There is a door standing just to the south, with the balcony extending both east and west.  The library's front steps are just below the open air to the north.

rooms.name: Balcony
rooms.description: There is a wonderful view to the east of this spot.  There is a vast expanse of endless fields at the bottom of the drop in that direction.  It is a good thing there is a sturdy railing to prevent accidents.  There is open air north above the steps to the library, and the balcony extends to the west.  Just to the south there is a door that looks tested by the elements, just like the stone of the balcony.

rooms.name: Hidden Staircase
rooms.description: Through this window is a beautiful view of the surrounding lands.  There is much to be seen and experienced beyond these walls.  To the east is a room housing a very smart man, who is very well read.  Below is a small staircase.

rooms.name: Scholar's Quarters
rooms.description: These quarters appear to house a very well read man.  There are books stacked high on the shelves, all seem to have been recently handled.  Above is a room that is beyond imagination.  There are stairs to the west and a small door north to the outside.

rooms.name: Top of the Stairs
rooms.description: There is a small staircase leading below here.  North there is a door leading out on to a balcony which must have a wonderful, panoramic view considering what can be seen through the small window to the east.

extras.text: Through this window is a beautiful view of the surrounding lands.  There is much to be seen and experianced beyond these walls.

rooms.name: Solarium
rooms.description: There are few words to describe the view around here.  It is possible to see tremendous distances in every direction.  There are bright fields, and tall bundles of trees speckling the countryside.  This is definately a fitting place for a wise scholar to live below, and a good location to sit and read for countless hours in the natural light coming in from any given side.

rooms.name: Map Room
rooms.description: The map room is rather large, extending far in all directions from the small staircase leading in from above.  There are four huge tables, each dimly lit with a few candles.  There is a small window on one side which provides for some natural light.  Each table has a delicately drawn map on it, detailing some of the surrounding countryside.

rooms.name: Meditation Garden
rooms.description: The peace and tranquility of these quiet meditation gardens are surpassed in no other location in the abbey complex.  Silent monks sit here quietly reading their selected texts, bettering themselves.  A hallway is west leading from the main library to the exit to the north.

rooms.name: Passage to the Guest House
rooms.description: There is a peculiar odor sneaking into this passageway from the north.  It is no wonder that the stables for housing visitor mounts lies in that direction.  There is a cozy guest house just east along the corridor lying beyond a small entry way.  The outer courtyard is just west continuing along.

rooms.name: Hidden Passageway
rooms.description: This small passageway leads to the north towards a small, nearly hidden staircase leading up.  Just to the south are some stacks of books, collecting dust at the moment.
